reviews.review_msg: I heard a lot of people complain about him, but honestly he was one the nicest instructors I've ever had. Pays a lot of attention to details but at the end of the day makes sure that you've understood the material properly. If you are willing to put in the work I recommend him 100%
This is one of the best instructors you could ever have. Classes are super interesting, very clear, with real like examples. Test correlate with the material covered in class! Just great

This guy is amazing! Our whole class actually stood up and clapped for him on the last class.. his grading is very fair and is willing to help students anytime. Just make sure you understand his assignments well.. each and every question! and you will get at least get a B+.. which is average when he curves..

Coming to class, practising her examples, and redoing homework assignments are the best way to make it through her class. She admires honesty and hard work, so if you're honest about not knowing something, she'll happily spend time to help you. She( her TA ) marks tough, so prepare as thoroughly as possible for her exams. She has high standards
AMAZING prof. So good at explaining things, has an answer for every question, and is super reasonable and friendly. Speaks clearly and he chooses good TAs.
wow this guy is absolutely amazing, definitely one of the best engineering profs at SFU.

He explained the material clearly and tested us on whatever he covered in the class. One easy midterm for this course and the average was high  around 85% so he decided to give  us couple of tricky questions in the final. Overall He is a nice guy and he cares a lot about the students and highly recommended!! BTW he got nice accent!!
Great guy, helpful and an easy marker.

Kamal's assignments and exam questions are all based off of his lecture notes and textbook. As long as you studied his notes and read textbook, you can make through without any issue. However, I'm not a big fan of his messy and disorganized notes since they are hard to read sometimes. Also he gives a lot of assignments. Other than that, solid prof.
Has bad temper! Watch out! And slow marker too!
Excellent!Very knowledgable.
Good prof. Very intelligent and enthusiastic!
Good guy overall...very helpful, clear and friendly. Nothing bad to say really. :)
Final is a killer!! This guy marks slowly. You get your marks like a month after u finish the midterm.
yes yes thank you thank you
No Comments

Likely the best professor in ENSC dept. High quality slides and encouraged questions from Majid ensure most students learn well. 5% bonus mark for participating. Class is test heavy but fair tests. Best way to learn is slide examples and HW review. Only downside is labs seemed a bit redundant. Scales to B- class avg. He is very fair and kind.

Faisal is definitely a great prof, and he treat people as friends. Although the course material was challenging, he kept the students in mind and catered each topic around our needs.  I've learned  so much from his lectures, and I apply them to the rest of my work. His mentoring truly had a positive impact in my life. No doubt, take his class..:)

Faisal is the best prof I have had in ensc. Lectures are informative, assignments can be time consuming but well worth doing since the account for 30% of your grade. Overall, great class and great prof.

Great prof, he makes everything clear and easy to understand during the lecture so you need minimal effort to be put for the midterm and the final. Also, his sense of humor makes the lecture worth attending. I ended up getting an A- but half of the class would end up in the A range(very rare in ensc). We need more engineering profs like him at sfu!

Great course and Great Prof. Although the last part of the course about design controller is a bit hard, once you understand it's very interesting and useful. I worked so hard on the final, and almost doubled my midterm. It's great semester

One of the BEST prof i have in my 6 years in sfu. Very very polite, friendly and notes are clear,concise and taught in a heart. Finals questions are direct examples from the text book while you have a double side cheat sheets lol!

Excellent prof, his lectures are exceptionally clear. Went to class and did well because he made sure everyone understood the material. Very helpful after class, as well. Only downside was homework assignments were weekly and very long.

So I have to write my final exam coming Monday and going through the Lecture notes of Dr.Beg, THEY ARE SO BLOODY CLEAR AND WELL PRESENTED! Man SOOOOOO Much respect for this guy. YOU SIR, ROCK!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Best Professor in the whole applied science faculty. really wants you to learn and encourages to ask questions all the time.

You will not find a better prof, I am a struggling student and I managed to pull off an A-, going to his lectures are very helpful and he encourages questions all the times. Very polite and good sense of humor.
amazing prof! midterm with an average of 67, final with average of 77. Half of the class are in the A and A- regions.
This guy is amazing. He goes over the material slowly and clearly. His tests are extremely fair, if you fail it, it's basically your fault. Very helpful. Open office hours, always there to help.
